query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 Buio d’inferno e di notte privata 2 d’ogne pianeto, sotto pover cielo, 3 quant’ esser può di nuvol tenebrata,
query.error: **English:** 1 Darkness of hell and of night deprived 2 of every planet, under a poor sky, 3 as much as it can be darkened by tenebrous clouds,
query.result: 1 Tywyllter an ifarn ha’n nos dibris 2 a bub planet, danow folen, 3 kyns lehevel a yll bos dallethys gans kewlow tywyll,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
4 non fece al viso mio sì grosso velo 5 come quel fummo ch’ivi ci coperse, 6 né a sentir di così aspro pelo,
query.error: **English:** 4 did not make so thick a veil for my face 5 as that smoke which covered us there, 6 nor was it so harsh to feel,
query.result: 4 na wrug dhe’m fas dhe’m lagha mor avel 5 ages an losow na’n keveris agan ena, 6 na dhe vos moy ages mor kalet,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 che l’occhio stare aperto non sofferse; 8 onde la scorta mia saputa e fida 9 mi s’accostò e l’omero m’offerse.
query.error: **English:** 7 that the eye could not bear to stay open; 8 whereupon my wise and faithful guide 9 drew near to me and offered me his shoulder.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 Sì come cieco va dietro a sua guida 11 per non smarrirsi e per non dar di cozzo 12 in cosa che ’l molesti, o forse ancida,
query.error: **English:** 10 As a blind man follows his guide 11 so as not to lose his way and not to bump 12 into something that might hurt him, or perhaps kill him,
query.result: 10 Avel dall a wra wosa y skorva 11 rag na vos kollet ha rag na vos gorra 12 orth traow a alla’n boes dhe’n, po dhe vos ladha,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 m’andava io per l’aere amaro e sozzo, 14 ascoltando il mio duca che diceva 15 pur: «Guarda che da me tu non sia mozzo».
query.error: **English:** 13 so I went through the bitter and foul air, 14 listening to my leader who kept saying: 15 “Watch out that you do not get separated from me”.
query.result: 13 hemma a veu drehedhes drehedhes an ayr feth ha brout, 14 ow klevs dhe’m duga a veu leverel: 15 “Gwel, na vos rannys orth y’n.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 Io sentia voci, e ciascuna pareva 17 pregar per pace e per misericordia 18 l’Agnel di Dio che le peccata leva.
query.error: **English:** 16 I heard voices, and each one seemed 17 to pray for peace and for mercy 18 to the Lamb of God who takes away sins.
query.result: 16 Me a glewas leusow, ha pub onan a veu leverel 17 dhe vos pedhi rag peth ha rag trugarowder 18 dhe’n Oen a Dhew a dhur an pechodow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 Pur ‘Agnus Dei’ eran le loro essordia; 20 una parola in tutte era e un modo, 21 sì che parea tra esse ogne concordia.
query.error: **English:** 19 Yet ‘Agnus Dei’ were their beginnings; 20 one word in all of them and one manner, 21 so that there seemed to be harmony among them.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 «Quei sono spirti, maestro, ch’i’ odo?», 23 diss’ io. Ed elli a me: «Tu vero apprendi, 24 e d’iracundia van solvendo il nodo».
query.error: **English:** 22 “Are those spirits, master, that I hear?”, 23 I said. And he to me: “You will learn the truth, 24 and they are loosening the knot of anger”.
query.result: 22 “Y re spyrys, mester, a’m glewaf?”, 23 me a leveris. Ha henna dhe’m: “Ty a dhyskow gwir, 24 ha y re ow tiskolgi an golon a wragh.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 «Or tu chi se’ che ’l nostro fummo fendi, 26 e di noi parli pur come se tue 27 partissi ancor lo tempo per calendi?».
query.error: **English:** 25 “Now who are you who cleaves our smoke, 26 and speak of us just as if you 27 were still dividing time by calends?”.
query.result: 25 “Mes ty, pyth yw os a dhrehedh agan losow, 26 ha leverel a-dro dhe agan avel dell yw ty 27 ow rannja bys ena an amser gans kalendasow?”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 Così per una voce detto fue; 29 onde ’l maestro mio disse: «Rispondi, 30 e domanda se quinci si va sùe».
query.error: **English:** 28 Thus it was said by a voice; 29 whereupon my master said: “Answer, 30 and ask if one goes up from here”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 E io: «O creatura che ti mondi 32 per tornar bella a colui che ti fece, 33 maraviglia udirai, se mi secondi».
query.error: **English:** 31 And I: “O creature who cleanses yourself 32 to return beautiful to him who made you, 33 you will hear a marvel, if you follow me”.
query.result: 31 Ha my: “O kreadur ages ythoth golon 32 rag dy dhyski dhe’n neb a’th grue, 33 my a wra dywedhes marvil, ages ythoth ow colon”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 «Io ti seguiterò quanto mi lece», 35 rispuose; «e se veder fummo non lascia, 36 l’udir ci terrà giunti in quella vece».
query.error: **English:** 34 "I will follow you as far as I am able," 35 he replied; "and if seeing smoke does not allow it, 36 hearing will keep us joined in that case."
query.result: 34 "Vy a'm sewgh yn kynth vythfyn," 35 ev a leveris; "ha gwel na wra'n foom, 36 an klev a'n kevergh ynwedh yn henna le."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 Allora incominciai: «Con quella fascia 38 che la morte dissolve men vo suso, 39 e venni qui per l’infernale ambascia.
query.error: **English:** 37 Then I began: "With a band 38 that death dissolves, I go up, 39 and I came here through the infernal anguish.
query.result: 37 An lavar a wrug: "Gans fas 38 na wra'n ankow trehedha vy dhe'n vys, 39 ha dos vy ama an ifern a'n angos."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 E se Dio m’ha in sua grazia rinchiuso, 41 tanto che vuol ch’i’ veggia la sua corte 42 per modo tutto fuor del moderno uso,
query.error: **English:** 40 And if God has enclosed me in his grace, 41 so that he wants me to see his court 42 in a way completely outside of modern custom,
query.result: 40 Ha gwell Duw vy yn y ras gronghys, 41 vel drok vy gwel y lys 42 yn fordh oll ow kul owlethys,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 non mi celar chi fosti anzi la morte, 44 ma dilmi, e dimmi s’i’ vo bene al varco; 45 e tue parole fier le nostre scorte».
query.error: **English:** 43 Do not hide from me who you were in death, 44 but tell me, and tell me if I am going well to the pass; 45 and let your words be our guides."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 «Lombardo fui, e fu’ chiamato Marco; 47 del mondo seppi, e quel valore amai 48 al quale ha or ciascun disteso l’arco.
query.error: **English:** 46 "I was Lombard, and I was called Marco; 47 I knew the world, and I loved that virtue 48 to which everyone now has turned their back.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 Per montar sù dirittamente vai». 50 Così rispuose, e soggiunse: «I’ ti prego 51 che per me prieghi quando sù sarai».
query.error: **English:** 49 To climb straight up, go." 50 Thus he answered, and added: "I pray you 51 that you pray for me when you are up there."
query.result: 49 Rag mos dhe-ves orth, mos dhe-ves orth." 50 Marow a leveris, ha leveris: "Me a'th pys 51 rag dhom pysi pan vo dhe-ves orth."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 E io a lui: «Per fede mi ti lego 53 di far ciò che mi chiedi; ma io scoppio 54 dentro ad un dubbio, s’io non me ne spiego.
query.error: **English:** 52 And I to him: "I swear to you 53 to do what you ask; but I burst 54 within with a doubt, if I do not explain myself.
query.result: 52 Ha my a'th leveris: "Rag fyth my a'th pys 53 rag ober an peth a vynsi; mes my a scoppi 54 a-ves dhe-ves orth, mar ny wra vy dywedhes."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
55 Prima era scempio, e ora è fatto doppio 56 ne la sentenza tua, che mi fa certo 57 qui, e altrove, quello ov’ io l’accoppio.
query.error: **English:** 55 Before, it was simple, and now it has become double 56 in your judgment, which makes me certain 57 here, and elsewhere, that where I join it.
query.result: 55 Kyns oedh scemp, ha lemmyn nyns yw mes dowbl 56 yn dha sens, a wra vy sicker 57 ama, ha yn le, lemmyn pan wra vy'n keppla.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 Lo mondo è ben così tutto diserto 59 d’ogne virtute, come tu mi sone, 60 e di malizia gravido e coverto;
query.error: **English:** 58 The world is indeed so deserted 59 of every virtue, as you tell me, 60 and pregnant and covered with malice;
query.result: 58 An bys yw marow mar ledan diergys 59 a-ves oll verthyans, mar a leveris vy, 60 ha lowen ha colen, ha gorrys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
61 ma priego che m’addite la cagione, 62 sì ch’i’ la veggia e ch’i’ la mostri altrui; 63 ché nel cielo uno, e un qua giù la pone».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 Alto sospir, che duolo strinse in «uhi!», 65 mise fuor prima; e poi cominciò: «Frate, 66 lo mondo è cieco, e tu vien ben da lui.

query.result: 64 Uchel assuhen, ow dolur a wrug yn "Uhi!", 65 a veu dheworth kyns; ha wosa: "Froder, 66 an bys yw dall, ha ty a dheu yn straght dhyworth ytho.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
67 Voi che vivete ogne cagion recate 68 pur suso al cielo, pur come se tutto 69 movesse seco di necessitate.
query.error: **English:** 67 You who live, attribute every cause 68 solely to heaven, just as if everything 69 moved with it out of necessity.
query.result: 67 Whewgh a vew ogne cagion recate 68 pur suso dhe'n nef, pur dell yw oll 69 a veu movyans gans anedha a-les.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
70 Se così fosse, in voi fora distrutto 71 libero arbitrio, e non fora giustizia 72 per ben letizia, e per male aver lutto.
query.error: **English:** 70 If it were so, free will would be destroyed in you, 71 and there would be no justice 72 for joy in good, and sorrow in evil.
query.result: 70 Mar keffrys o, ynwi a veu distruys 71 frank-arbed, ha na veu jystyns 72 rag paradow rag les, ha rag drok kavos.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
73 Lo cielo i vostri movimenti inizia; 74 non dico tutti, ma, posto ch’i’ ’l dica, 75 lume v’è dato a bene e a malizia,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
76 e libero voler; che, se fatica 77 ne le prime battaglie col ciel dura, 78 poi vince tutto, se ben si notrica.
query.error: **English:** 76 and free will; which, if it struggles 77 in the first battles with heaven, 78 then conquers all, if it is well nourished.
query.result: 76 ha frank-voller; ow, mar a wrastla 77 yn kynsa brysyow gans an nef, 78 wosa henna a wra gwaynya oll, mar a veu boos magajys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
79 A maggior forza e a miglior natura 80 liberi soggiacete; e quella cria 81 la mente in voi, che ’l ciel non ha in sua cura.
query.error: **English:** 79 To a greater force and to a better nature 80 you are subject freely; and that creates 81 the mind in you, which heaven does not have in its care.
query.result: 79 dhe voyes moy ha gwell natur 80 frank yw aga sojettys; ha henna a grhya 81 an menydh ynwi, an nef na’n jev yn y geverel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
82 Però, se ’l mondo presente disvia, 83 in voi è la cagione, in voi si cheggia; 84 e io te ne sarò or vera spia.
query.error: **English:** 82 Therefore, if the present world goes astray, 83 the cause is in you, in you it should be sought; 84 and I will now be a true guide for you in this.

85 Esce di mano a lui che la vagheggia 86 prima che sia, a guisa di fanciulla 87 che piangendo e ridendo pargoleggia,

Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
88 l’anima semplicetta che sa nulla, 89 salvo che, mossa da lieto fattore, 90 volontier torna a ciò che la trastulla.

query.result: 88 an eneval sempel ow na wodh nevra, 89 mes, movyans gans gwrier lowen, 90 a wra kolontya dhe’n tra a wra y lowena.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
91 Di picciol bene in pria sente sapore; 92 quivi s’inganna, e dietro ad esso corre, 93 se guida o fren non torce suo amore.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
97 Le leggi son, ma chi pon mano ad esse? 98 Nullo, però che ’l pastor che procede, 99 rugumar può, ma non ha l’unghie fesse;
query.error: **English:** 97 The laws exist, but who enforces them? 98 No one, because the shepherd who leads 99 can ruminate, but he does not have cloven hooves;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
100 per che la gente, che sua guida vede 101 pur a quel ben fedire ond’ ella è ghiotta, 102 di quel si pasce, e più oltre non chiede.
query.error: **English:** 100 so the people, who see their leader 101 striking only at that good which they crave, 102 feed on that and ask for nothing more.
query.result: 100 rag henna an bobel, ow a wel y aga ledyer 101 ow skeul dhe’n da dhyworth henna yns i a-gar, 102 a dheu magajys gans henna, ha nyns eus ow hwel moy.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
103 Ben puoi veder che la mala condotta 104 è la cagion che ’l mondo ha fatto reo, 105 e non natura che ’n voi sia corrotta.
query.error: **English:** 103 You can clearly see that evil conduct 104 is the reason that the world has become wicked, 105 and not nature, which is not corrupted in you.
query.result: 103 Ty a yl weles may fleghes drok 104 yw an acheson a wra dhe bys mar, 105 ha nen anedhel a yw drogys ynnos.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 Soleva Roma, che ’l buon mondo feo, 107 due soli aver, che l’una e l’altra strada 108 facean vedere, e del mondo e di Deo.
query.error: **English:** 106 Rome, which made the world good, 107 used to have two suns, which showed 108 both the one way and the other, of the world and of God.
query.result: 106 Roma a wrug an bys da, 107 dew solemp o, an eyl ha’n aral 108 a wrug gweles, bys ha Duw.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
109 L’un l’altro ha spento; ed è giunta la spada 110 col pasturale, e l’un con l’altro insieme 111 per viva forza mal convien che vada;
query.error: **English:** 109 One has extinguished the other; and the sword 110 has joined with the shepherd’s staff, and one with the other 111 must necessarily go badly together by main force;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 però che, giunti, l’un l’altro non teme: 113 se non mi credi, pon mente a la spiga, 114 ch’ogn’ erba si conosce per lo seme.
query.error: **English:** 112 because, when joined, one does not fear the other: 113 if you do not believe me, look at the ear of corn, 114 for every plant is known by its seed.

Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
115 In sul paese ch’Adice e Po riga, 116 solea valore e cortesia trovarsi, 117 prima che Federigo avesse briga;
query.error: **English:** 115 In the land where the Adige and Po rivers flow, 116 valour and courtesy used to be found, 117 before Frederick had any trouble;

Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
118 or può sicuramente indi passarsi 119 per qualunque lasciasse, per vergogna 120 di ragionar coi buoni o d’appressarsi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
121 Ben v’èn tre vecchi ancora in cui rampogna 122 l’antica età la nova, e par lor tardo 123 che Dio a miglior vita li ripogna:
query.error: **English:** 121 There are still three old men in whom 122 the old age rebukes the new, and it seems to them too slow 123 for God to take them to a better life:
query.result: 121 Mes tri yw dew hen dhe wosa ynno 122 an oos oos ow kul ow kul dhe vos ow kul 123 rag Duw dhe vos dhe weles byw ow kul:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
124 Currado da Palazzo e ’l buon Gherardo 125 e Guido da Castel, che mei si noma, 126 francescamente, il semplice Lombardo.

query.result: 124 Currado a Balas ha’n da Gherardo 125 ha Guido a Gastel, an gwella henwys, 126 yn an fordh Frynkek, an Lombard sempel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
127 Dì oggimai che la Chiesa di Roma, 128 per confondere in sé due reggimenti, 129 cade nel fango, e sé brutta e la soma».
query.error: **English:** 127 Say now that the Church of Rome, 128 in order to confuse two governments in itself, 129 falls into the mire, and befouls itself and its burden.
query.result: 127 Lever mes lemmyn bos Eglos Ruwvan, 128 rag dhe guntel ynno dew rewlys, 129 ow kodha yn an fank, ha ow halloppy y honan ha’y honas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
130 «O Marco mio», diss’ io, «bene argomenti; 131 e or discerno perché dal retaggio 132 li figli di Levì furono essenti.
query.error: **English:** 130 "O my Mark," said I, "you reason well; 131 and now I discern why from the heritage 132 the sons of Levi were exempt."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
133 Ma qual Gherardo è quel che tu per saggio 134 di’ ch’è rimaso de la gente spenta, 135 in rimprovèro del secol selvaggio?».
query.error: **English:** 133 But what Gherardo is that whom you, as wise, 134 say has remained of the extinct race, 135 in reproof of the savage age?"
query.result: 133 Mes pyth yw an Gherardo henna a lever 134 a leveris ow tos remenas 135 a-wosa an oes dheghow gwyls?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
136 «O tuo parlar m’inganna, o el mi tenta», 137 rispuose a me; «ché, parlandomi tosco, 138 par che del buon Gherardo nulla senta.
query.error: **English:** 136 "Either your speech deceives me, or it tempts me," 137 he replied to me; "for, speaking Tuscan to me, 138 it seems that you know nothing of the good Gherardo.
query.result: 136 "Eth yth leverel po gorra po y'm tempttya," 137 ev a leveris dhym; "rag, ow leverel tuscan dhym, 138 yth leveris na wodhvos a-dro dhe'n Gherardo da."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
139 Per altro sopranome io nol conosco, 140 s’io nol togliessi da sua figlia Gaia. 141 Dio sia con voi, ché più non vegno vosco.
query.error: **English:** 139 By any other surname I do not know him, 140 unless I were to take it from his daughter Gaia. 141 God be with you, for I come with you no more.
query.result: 139 Mes rag erel surname aral y'm owth ytho, 140 mar nas kyfen ef a'y verch Gaia. 141 An Duw genowgh why, rag ny vynnaf mos dha vos.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
142 Vedi l’albor che per lo fummo raia 143 già biancheggiare, e me convien partirmi 144 (l’angelo è ivi) prima ch’io li paia».
query.error: **English:** 142 See the dawn that breaks white 143 through the smoke, and I must depart 144 (the angel is there) before I appear to him."
query.result: 142 Gweles an albor a leveris dre'n fumm raia 143 ow whyta, ha my a wra dhe partir 144 (an angel yw ena) kyns na leveraf dhetho."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
145 Così tornò, e più non volle udirmi.
query.error: **English:** 145 Thus he returned, and would not hear me more.
query.result: 145 Vel henna a dheuthas, ha nyns esa moy esedhes dhym.
